page.title: 14WHITEHAVEN MUSEUM.
page.content: The exhibits in Whitehaven Museum range from stone age axes to brownie regalia.Some exhibits need special care like the medieval St.Bees shroud, which is one of the 20,000 exhibits on show.Mr Fancy (the curator) told us that there were quite a few exhibits in store which are often used by researchers.The Market Hall building was built in 1885 but it has only been a museum since 1975.There is a tourist information centre which hasn't always been there. This attracts more people.The museum is financed by the local council,grants from large museums and by a support group.They get 60,000 visitors a year, 5% being foreign tourists.Occasionally they get things they can't identify.The museum is a good source of information, particularly on items of local interest.
